entry.tran: 室友;合租一套公寓（或一幢房子）的人
entry.def: Your roommate is the person you share a rented room, apartment, or house with, for example when you are at university.
Your roommate is the person you share a rented room with, for example when you are at university.

means.word_mean: 1. an associate who shares a room with you

Sentence.sentence: Accompany her roommate to the classroom.
Help her roommate with her report
According to two recent studies, randomly assigned roommates of different races are more likely to experience conflicts so strained that one roommate will move out.

In a study analyzing data on thousands of Ohio State freshmen who lived in dorms, he found that black freshmen who came to college with high standardized test scores earned better grades if they had a white roommate — even if the roommate's test scores were low.
Perhaps, the study speculated, having a white roommate helps academically prepared black students adjust to a predominantly white university
Because interracial roommate relationships are often problematic, Dr. Fazio said, many students would like to move out, but university housing policies may make it hard to leave.

sentences.en: Joyce has been under a cloud since her roommate’s bracelet disappeared.
sentences.cn: 自从室友的手镯不见以后,乔伊斯一直受到怀疑。

sentences.en: I learned from his roommate that he had been in hospital for over a week.
sentences.cn: 从他的室友那里,我知道他已经进医院一个多星期了。

sentences.en: He was as cross as two sticks when his roommate took his umbrella without getting his agreement.
sentences.cn: 他非常生气,因为他的室友未经同意就把他的伞带走了。

sentences.en: I yelled in my dream, which startled my roommate out of his sleep.
sentences.cn: 我梦中的喊叫声惊醒了同屋伙伴。

sentences.en: You should choose a roommate more compatible to your tastes.
